segment.source: Creating a New Software Driver
segment.target: Creating a New Software Driver

segment.source: In this topic we explain how to use Visual Studio to start writing a new software driver.
segment.target: In this topic we explain how to use Visual Studio to start writing a new software driver.

segment.source: Software drivers are different from device function drivers, filter drivers, and file system drivers, which we cover in other topics.
segment.target: Software drivers are different from device function drivers, filter drivers, and file system drivers, which we cover in other topics.

segment.source: For more information about software drivers and how they differ from other types of drivers, see What is a Driver? and Choosing a Driver Model.
segment.target: For more information about software drivers and how they differ from other types of drivers, see What is a Driver? and Choosing a Driver Model.

segment.source: To begin, first determine which driver model is appropriate for your software driver.
segment.target: To begin, first determine which driver model is appropriate for your software driver.

segment.source: The three options are the Kernel Mode Driver Framework (KMDF), the legacy NT driver model, and the Windows Driver Model (WDM).
segment.target: The three options are the Kernel Mode Driver Framework (KMDF), the legacy NT driver model, and the Windows Driver Model (WDM).

segment.source: For help determining which model is best for you, see Choosing a Driver Model.
segment.target: For help determining which model is best for you, see Choosing a Driver Model.

segment.source: Case 1: You want to use KMDF.
segment.target: Case 1: You want to use KMDF.

segment.source: In Visual Studio, on the File menu, choose New | Project.
segment.target: In Visual Studio, on the File menu, choose New | Project.

segment.source: In the New Project dialog box, in the left pane, locate and select WDF.
segment.target: In the New Project dialog box, in the left pane, locate and select WDF.

segment.source: In the middle pane, select Kernel Mode Driver (KMDF).
segment.target: In the middle pane, select Kernel Mode Driver (KMDF).

segment.source: Fill in the Name and Location boxes, and click OK.
segment.target: Fill in the Name and Location boxes, and click OK.

segment.source: For more details, see Writing a KMDF Driver Based on a Template.
segment.target: For more details, see Writing a KMDF Driver Based on a Template.

segment.source: Note When you create a new KMDF driver, you must select a driver name that has 32 characters or less.
segment.target: Note When you create a new KMDF driver, you must select a driver name that has 32 characters or less.

segment.source: This length limit is defined in wdfglobals.h.
segment.target: This length limit is defined in wdfglobals.h.

segment.source: At this point, you have a driver project that implements the general code required by most KMDF drivers.
segment.target: At this point, you have a driver project that implements the general code required by most KMDF drivers.

segment.source: Now you can supply the code that is specific to your software driver.
segment.target: Now you can supply the code that is specific to your software driver.

segment.source: Case 2: You want to use the legacy NT model.
segment.target: Case 2: You want to use the legacy NT model.

segment.source: In Visual Studio, on the File menu, choose New | Project.
segment.target: In Visual Studio, on the File menu, choose New | Project.

segment.source: In Visual Studio, in the New Project dialog box, under Windows Driver, select WDM | Empty WDM Driver.
segment.target: In Visual Studio, in the New Project dialog box, under Windows Driver, select WDM | Empty WDM Driver.

segment.source: Note You are not going to write a WDM driver, but you need the Empty WDM Driver template.
segment.target: Note You are not going to write a WDM driver, but you need the Empty WDM Driver template.

segment.source: Fill in the Name and Location boxes, and click OK.
segment.target: Fill in the Name and Location boxes, and click OK.

segment.source: At this point, you have an empty WDM driver project.
segment.target: At this point, you have an empty WDM driver project.

segment.source: In the Solution Explorer window, right-click your driver project, and choose Add | New Item.
segment.target: In the Solution Explorer window, right-click your driver project, and choose Add | New Item.

segment.source: In the Add New Item dialog box, select C++ File (.cpp), enter a name for your file, and click OK.
segment.target: In the Add New Item dialog box, select C++ File (.cpp), enter a name for your file, and click OK.

segment.source: Note If you want to create a .c file instead of a .cpp file, enter a name that has the .c extension.
segment.target: Note If you want to create a .c file instead of a .cpp file, enter a name that has the .c extension.

segment.source: Include ntddk.h.
segment.target: Include ntddk.h.

segment.source: Implement the functions required by your software driver.
segment.target: Implement the functions required by your software driver.

segment.source: As you implement and organize your functions, you might decide to add header files and additional .cpp or .c files.
segment.target: As you implement and organize your functions, you might decide to add header files and additional .cpp or .c files.

segment.source: Case 3: You want to use WDM.
segment.target: Case 3: You want to use WDM.

segment.source: It is extremely unlikely that you'll want to use WDM for a software driver.
segment.target: It is extremely unlikely that you'll want to use WDM for a software driver.

segment.source: But if you do, follow these steps.
segment.target: But if you do, follow these steps.

segment.source: In Visual Studio, on the File menu, choose New | Project.
segment.target: In Visual Studio, on the File menu, choose New | Project.

segment.source: In Visual Studio, in the New Project dialog box, under Windows Driver, select WDM.
segment.target: In Visual Studio, in the New Project dialog box, under Windows Driver, select WDM.

segment.source: Fill in the Name and Location boxes, and click OK.
segment.target: Fill in the Name and Location boxes, and click OK.

segment.source: At this point, you have an empty WDM driver project.
segment.target: At this point, you have an empty WDM driver project.

segment.source: In the Solution Explorer window, right-click your driver project, and choose Add | New Item.
segment.target: In the Solution Explorer window, right-click your driver project, and choose Add | New Item.

segment.source: In the Add New Item dialog box, select C++ File (.cpp), enter a name for your file, and click OK.
segment.target: In the Add New Item dialog box, select C++ File (.cpp), enter a name for your file, and click OK.

segment.source: Note If you want to create a .c file instead of a .cpp file, enter a name that has the .c extension.
segment.target: Note If you want to create a .c file instead of a .cpp file, enter a name that has the .c extension.

segment.source: Include wdm.h.
segment.target: Include wdm.h.

segment.source: Implement the functions required by your software driver.
segment.target: Implement the functions required by your software driver.

segment.source: As you implement and organize your functions, you might decide to add header files and additional .cpp or .c files.
segment.target: As you implement and organize your functions, you might decide to add header files and additional .cpp or .c files.
